name: Dar-us-Sakina
mission: DAR-US-SAKINA IS A 501(C)(3) NONPROFIT ORGANIZATION DEDICATED TO INCLUSION OF INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES IN THE MUSLIM COMMUNITY OF HOUSTON. OUR PLATFORM IS A SAFE SPACE FOR PEOPLE OF ALL ABILITIES AND THEIR CAREGIVERS. WE INSPIRE THE COMMUNITY TO ABANDON STIGMAS AND EMBRACE INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WITH EMPATHY AND RESPECT. TOGETHER, WE ARE BETTER.
theoryOfChange: Dar-us-Sakina outlines its strategic approach through its stated mission, vision, and values, and details its programming within three key service areas: education, support, and community awareness. Their mission is to provide inclusive opportunities and resources to individuals with disabilities and their caregivers in the Muslim community of Houston, with a vision for a community where individuals with disabilities are fully accepted and included, and have adequate access to resources and support. Their core values are Compassion, Acceptance, Responsibility, and Empathy. The charity implements this through programs such as the Sakina Internship Program, Volunteer Enrichment Program, Youth Inclusion Training, and Community Events, all designed to foster inclusivity and change community perceptions. An external article further describes their model as one that 'uses faith values to drive the work outside of the traditional congregational space' and 'offers an inclusive community that seeks to strengthen educational and social support for families,' integrating Islamic values to advance parent support and empowerment.

score_details.score_summary: Dar-us-Sakina shows good alignment and good impact, with zakat compliance. Evidence score may reflect limited reporting capacity, not program weakness.

all_citations.claim: The charity has a score of 93.0/100 and a program expense ratio of 72.2%.
Total revenue is $540,354 with fundraising efficiency of $0.13 per $1 raised and 15.9 months of working capital.
The mission is to provide inclusive opportunities for individuals with disabilities in the Muslim community of Houston.
The charity operates programs including the Sakina Sunday School and Sakina Internship.
The organization provides services and initiatives for beneficiaries with special needs.
The organization is recognized as Zakat-eligible.
The charity provides Islamic education and caregiver support groups.
The charity tracks metrics for special needs students enrolled and community members trained in disability awareness.
The charity offers various donation options and giving methods.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: Dar-us-Sakina earns a GMG score of 66/100, reflecting excellent financial accountability and high alignment with Muslim donor values, balanced by a medium data confidence level.
areas_for_improvement: Limited data confidence regarding long-term impact metrics
High cost per beneficiary for specialized capacity-building services

dimension_explanations.alignment: Dar-us-Sakina shows high alignment with donor needs as a Zakat-eligible institution addressing the urgent cause of global education and disability inclusion [8][11]. The organization has a established track record of providing specialized Islamic education and caregiver support groups within the Houston area [9][10].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization focuses on capacity building through the Sakina Sunday School and internship programs, serving students with special needs and training community members in disability awareness [4][10]. While the cost per beneficiary is relatively high at approximately $3,948, the charity demonstrates effectiveness by maintaining a 72.2% program expense ratio and robust working capital of 15.9 months [1][2].

baseline_narrative.headline: Dar-us-Sakina empowers individuals with disabilities in the Houston Muslim community through inclusive education and specialized support services.
strengths: High financial efficiency with a program expense ratio of 72.2%
Strong liquidity with 15.9 months of working capital
Zakat-eligible status supporting families through dedicated funds
Low fundraising costs of only $0.13 per $1 raised
baseline_narrative.summary: Based in Houston, Dar-us-Sakina provides inclusive opportunities and Islamic education for individuals with disabilities while empowering their families [3][6]. The organization maintains a strong financial standing with a Charity Navigator score of 93.0/100 and total revenue of $540,354 [1][2].
